alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 10:01PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Windy And Warmer Saturday Night And Sunday... Strong east winds and blowing snow will develop over Steese, Elliott and Dalton Highway Summits late Saturday night and continue into Sunday night. East winds will increase to 30 to 40 mph and cause heavy drifting snow over summits. Temperatures in these areas will rise well above zero so that wind chills will not be severe. Fairbanks will see temperatures rising late Saturday night into Sunday, along with east winds of 15 to 20 mph. Areas near the Alaska Range, such as Delta Junction and Healy, will see moderate Chinook winds developing Saturday night and continuing into Sunday. South to east winds will gust to 50 mph along the Alaska Range Sunday, with temperatures rising into the 20s and 30s.
